item.title: By: mhernandez
item.dc:creator: mhernandez
item.description:
In lenny and ufw 0.25+ (which is what i've been using), you can do a
ln -s /usr/share/ufw/ufw-init /etc/init.d/ufw
and then a
update-rc.d ufw defaults
to make ufw start at boot time.
item.content:encoded:
In lenny and ufw 0.25+ (which is what i’ve been using), you can do a

ln -s /usr/share/ufw/ufw-init /etc/init.d/ufw

and then a

update-rc.d ufw defaults

to make ufw start at boot time.

item.title: By: Hang

item.description: Also should do a "sudo ln -fs /lib/ufw/ufw-init /etc/init.d/ufw", and then do regular link to etc/rc?.d/ to make sure ufw is started during boot time.
